Simple Present Tense
Bloque Inicial/Initial Block
Discover the World of English: Objectives, Topics and Fun
Simple Present Tense

The Simple Present tense is a fundamental grammatical structure in English used to describe actions, events, or situations that occur regularly, as well as general truths or timeless facts. Whether expressing daily routines, habits, or stating universal truths, the Simple Present helps convey information in a clear and straightforward manner. Its structure varies based on the subject, employing the base form of the verb for most subjects and adding "s" or "es" for third-person singular subjects. Mastering the Simple Present is crucial for effective communication, enabling speakers to convey present actions, routines, and enduring truths in a concise and accurate manner.
El tiempo presente simple es una estructura gramatical fundamental en inglés que se utiliza para describir acciones, eventos o situaciones que ocurren regularmente, así como verdades generales o hechos atemporales. Ya sea expresando rutinas diarias, hábitos o afirmando verdades universales, el Presente Simple ayuda a transmitir información de una manera clara y sencilla. Su estructura varía según el sujeto, empleando la forma base del verbo para la mayoría de los sujetos y agregando "s" o "es" para los sujetos en tercera persona del singular. Dominar el presente simple es crucial para una comunicación efectiva, ya que permite a los oradores transmitir acciones, rutinas y verdades duraderas del presente de una manera concisa y precisa.
Text and Tasks
Initial Block/ Bloque Inicial

"Welcome, learners! Embark on this exciting English language journey with enthusiasm. Each step brings you closer to communication mastery. Enjoy the process, and remember, every effort is a step towards language proficiency. Let's begin this adventure together!"

"¡Bienvenidos estudiantes! Embárquense en este apasionante viaje del idioma inglés con entusiasmo. Cada paso los acerca al dominio de la comunicación. Disfruten el proceso y recuerden, cada esfuerzo es un paso hacia el dominio del idioma. ¡Comencemos esta aventura juntos!"

Sección de Información/ Information Section

Sección de Interacción/ Interaction Section
Information Section/ Sección de Información
What are we going to learn?

• "Descubre el Mundo del Inglés: Objetivos, Temas y Diversión"
  • "Evaluación Estelar: Navegando la Rúbrica de Aprendizaje"
  • "Amigos de la Clase: Presentándonos en un Mundo Virtual"
Objective/ Objetivo

At the end of this lesson, students will be able to understand and correctly apply the present simple in affirmative, negative and interrogative sentences. In addition, they will be able to identify and correctly use verbs in the third person singular, and will be familiar with the use of adverbs of frequency in everyday contexts.

Al finalizar esta lección, los estudiantes serán capaces de comprender y aplicar correctamente el presente simple en oraciones afirmativas, negativas e interrogativas. Además, podrán identificar y utilizar los verbos en tercera persona singular correctamente, y estarán familiarizados con el uso de adverbios de frecuencia en contextos cotidianos.
Text and Tasks
Values/ Valores

Responsibility, honesty, collaboration, perseverance, concentration.

Responsabilidad, honestidad, colaboración, perseverancia, concentración.
Text and Tasks
Proposal/ Propuesta

Implement educational actions aimed at strengthening mastery of the present simple in English, through effective practices and a deep understanding of its grammatical foundations.

Implementar acciones educativas destinadas a fortalecer el dominio del presente simple en inglés, mediante prácticas efectivas y una comprensión profunda de sus fundamentos gramaticales.
Text and Tasks

• Simple Present Tense Uses
  • Simple Present Tense Gramatical Structures
  • Complementary Resources/ Recursos Complementarios

Check your Progress
University of Auckland

Although more often used in formal testing situations MCQs can be used as a testing tool to stimulate thought and discussion on topics students may feel a little reticent in responding to. When designing a MCQ test consider the following:
  • What learning outcomes are the questions testing
  • What intellectual skills are being tested
  • What are the language skills of the audience
  • Gender and cultural issues
  • Avoid grammar language and question structures that might provide clues

When building an MCQ consider the following:
  • Use phrases that learners are familiar with and have encountered in their study
  • Keep responses concise
  • There should be some consistency between the stem and the responses
  • Provide enough options to challenge learners to think about their response
  • Try to make sure that correct responses are not more detailed than the distractors
  • Distractors should be incorrect but plausible

She _____ the piano every evening.

Academic Block/ Bloque Académico
Journey to Present Time: Exploring Simple Present Tense!

Dear students, we are now in the academic phase in which we will seek to expand our knowledge and consolidate our learning. We urge you to carefully examine all available information and carry out the activities associated with each topic. Join us in this discovery process!

Estimados estudiantes, ahora nos encontramos en la fase académica en la que buscaremos ampliar nuestros conocimientos y consolidar nuestros aprendizajes. Le instamos a examinar detenidamente toda la información disponible y realizar las actividades asociadas a cada tema. ¡Únase a nosotros en este proceso de descubrimiento!

Topic 1: The Simple Present Uses

Topic 2: The Simple Present Grammatical Structures
WEEK1 – Monday 15- Thursday 18: Simple Present Tense Uses
Text and Tasks

The simple present tense is really important when we talk in English. We use it to talk about things we do every day or all the time, like daily habits and routines. We also use it to say facts that are always true. For example, we can say "I play video games every evening" or "The sun rises in the east." It helps us tell stories and give instructions too. When we look at a schedule or plan, we see the simple present tense telling us when things happen. So, understanding and using the simple present tense helps us talk about what we do, what's true, and what's happening now in a simple and clear way.

El presente simple es realmente importante cuando hablamos en inglés. Lo usamos para hablar de cosas que hacemos todos los días o todo el tiempo, como hábitos y rutinas diarias. También lo usamos para decir hechos que siempre son ciertos. Por ejemplo, podemos decir "Juego videojuegos todas las noches" o "El sol sale por el este". Nos ayuda a contar historias y también a dar instrucciones. Cuando miramos un cronograma o plan, vemos el tiempo presente simple que nos dice cuándo suceden las cosas. Entonces, comprender y utilizar el tiempo presente simple nos ayuda a hablar sobre lo que hacemos, lo que es verdad y lo que está sucediendo ahora de una manera sencilla y clara.

Text and Tasks
My Story in English: Magic Presentation Forum
My Presentation

Hi students, we are going to introduce ourselves in this section. It's important that you consider some suggestions:

  • Enter the link Padlet: https://padlet.com/britneyleon/personal-information-about-ourselves-cg177lj21vu084xe
  • Each students must make an intervention.
  • To do it, make a new publication y answer the questions. (Check the example)
  • Questions:

1._ What is your name?

2._ How old are you?

3._ Where are you from?

4._ Do you have any favorite hobbies?

5._ Where do you study?

6._ What is your favorite subject in school, and why?

7._ How many people live with you?

8._Are there any places you would love to visit in the future?

9._ What is your favorite type of music?

10._ How do you describe your personality?

  • When making your publication, write your name and surname along with your answers. Remember add a nice photograph of you, add it to your information.

Forum Rules

1. Be respectful.
2. Do not comment on your colleagues' posts.
3. Use appropriate language.
4. Don't spam.
5. Be honest about the information given.
6. Check grammar and spelling.
